name: Ellerman House

reviews.title: It does not get better than this!
reviews.text: Nothing we can say will give justice to just how fantastic a place that is Ellerman House.

reviews.title: If You Stay One Place in Cape Town, Make it Ellerman House!
reviews.text: Location, Location, Location: The aspect is fabulous, perched on a hill overlooking Bantry Bay - the view is breathtaking. It is easy to head south out of Cape Town toward Clifton Beaches and Twelve Apostle Mountain on your way to Cape Point, or head into the waterfront area with the great food and lovely shopping. Everything is within reach. But the view, simply stunning!

reviews.title: Intimate yet spacious
reviews.text: Service is everything: The second you arrive, you feel a sense of security and tranquillity as they greet you and wipe away all your weariness and fatigue as they envelop you with the most wonderful welcome that is not only a feature of Cape Town, but a Hallmark of Ellerman House. Tim Cumming, the General Manager, is such a gracious host, and he makes sure everything is inviting and warm and courteous. He enfranchises his team to excel in hospitality in a way that we could only wish was possible in Europe – they all seek to make your stay a calming, wonderful experience – and it does feel that way all the time.

reviews.title: best ever!
reviews.text: we have stayed at the world's best places,e.g.,fregate island seychelles, singita private reserve south africa, sandy lane barbados,etc., and the ellerman house tops them all. even for the jaded , it is over the top, the best ever.

reviews.title: Exceptional
reviews.text: From the time my daughter and I checked in we felt as though we were staying at the home of a friend. The room was lovely and views were stunning. The pantry was open for refreshments, our laundry was taken care of, sun tan lotion was provided and nothing appeared on the bill as 'extras'.

reviews.title: Discrete Elegance
reviews.text: The food was exceptional, as was the service. I loved the wine waiter and the way he spoke of the hotel as 'we'. 'We' send the staff to Stellenbosch to taste the wines, for example. He so obviously felt part of a family and not an employee. The training of the staff was world class, as was the art collection.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would never stay anywhere else in Cape Town now: I just wish that I had discovered Ellerman House earlier.
reviews.title: A truly great hotel
Can you get any better than this?
reviews.text: I was really not sure what to expect from Ellerman House, all the reviews I had read suggested that it was going to be good but as with everything one persons perception and values are often wide of your own. So it was a great relief and surprise to arrive and find out that all the reviews were accurate and if anything the standard of accommodation, service and location far out shone my expectation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ellerman House is true luxury. The hotel strives to (and will!) accomodate all of your whims-- from serving absolutely anything via room service (not on the menu? no problem!), to providing a very glamorous wet bar in your suite, to running your bath for you (complete with rose petals). Our room was palatial -- absolutely enormous with a stunning view. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: A truly elegant experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here when we arrived and had a view to die for - loved it and staff great and what a way to start our holiday. The room was good but the experience just fantastic - if this is South AFrica we cant wait to get more of it!
reviews.title: A view to take your breath away

reviews.text: Stayed at the EH for first three nights after my arrival to SA. The hotel is absolute haven for a discreet traveler how wants to enjoy their stay and not worry about crowded hotel lobbies. Although I'm normally fussy about hotels, there was absolutely nothing to complain about. Staff was very welcoming, friendly and attentive even though I arrived early at 5am(it was early in the season and low occupancy). The room was ready and they served me a freshly brewed coffee and morning papers. The house and rooms are kept in a very clean, elegant design. Housekeeping was highly efficient. Breakfast is very rich and features fantastic pastries. In the Spa the environment, cleanliness and the marvelous experience made me forget about my long flight to CT. If anyone out there plans to visit EH try out this spa. In the office I found Mark, an extremely helpful and nice customer relations manager who helped me proactively in solving my changing travel arrangements. He took a lot of time to make numerous phone calls and on-line reservations.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel/sperb location/helpful personnel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I want to underline the beauty of the EH grounds, decoration and location, and the kindness and support of all personnel. Would highly recommend and definitely come back!
reviews.title: In a league of its own

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If I had all the money in the world (and you would need it) I would live here. This hotel is the first I have ever stayed in that I would describe as divine.
reviews.title: Enigmatic Ellerman

description: Ellerman House commands spectacular views over the Atlantic Ocean. Professional and charming staff plus a remarkable art & wine collection leave guests breathless. Consisting of 9 bedrooms and 2 suites in the House, and the neighboring contemporary Villa and Spa, the property embodies the best in South African hospitality in true Relais & Chateaux style. Ellerman House is the place to stay in Africa’s fair Cape.
